programme.title: The 700 Club
programme.desc: A religious-themed newsmagazine, one of TV's longest-running programs. On the air since 1966, it launched nationally in '72, before becoming the flagship of the Christian Broadcast Network in 1977. It mixes news---from a religious perspective---with inspirational interviews with celebrities, along with Bible readings and entertainment. Conservative icon (and 1988 presidential candidate) Pat Robertson founded the hugely popular program from a 1963 fund-raising pledge effort on UHF TV in Virginia. (cc)(n).

programme.title: The Price Is Right
programme.desc: "Come on down!" Contestants guess retail values for prizes on TV's longest-running game show. Bob Barker racked up over a dozen hosting Emmys since CBS first aired the daytime staple in 1972. When Barker retired in 2007, Drew Carey stepped in to ably fill his shoes. (cc)(n).

programme.title: Cops
programme.desc: Real-life officers are followed by a camera crew, cinéma-vérité style, in a gritty up-close look at police work and the consequences of crime. programme.title: King of the Hill
programme.desc: Sharp cartoon comedy chronicling the trials of proud Texas propane salesman Hank Hill, his family and their ragtag neighbors. From Mike Judge, the mind behind MTV's 'Beavis and Butt-head,' this one has heart where the other had guts, and fit nicely on Fox's Sunday-night lineup with 'The Simpsons' when it debuted in midseason in 1997. Judge's cocreator is `The Simpsons' former executive producer, Greg Daniels. (cc).(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Animated antics of the constantly grousing Griffins, a family that put some fun in dysfunctional. While dad Peter is a tad dim and lazy, mom Lois is none of the above. Then there are hapless teens Meg and Chris; sassy baby Stewie, who's wise (and a wise guy) beyond his years; and family dog Brian, who might be the smartest of the lot. Series creator Seth MacFarlane voices many of the regular characters. In 2002, Fox dumped the show, but revived it in 2005 after it became a top-selling DVD. (cc).(n)

programme.title: English Premier League Soccer
programme.sub-title: Sunderland AFC vs. Leicester City FC

programme.title: English Premier League Soccer
programme.sub-title: Stoke City FC vs. Burnley FC

programme.title: NFL Football: Dolphins at Ravens
programme.desc: Miami (7-4) at Baltimore (6-5). Adam Gase's Dolphins swim into BB&T Stadium on a six-game win streak, with RB Jay Ajayi facing a Ravens run defense that has allowed just 53.3 ypg at home. Miami won 15-13 last season to snap a five-game series skid that included the Fins' most recent playoff appearance, after the 2008 season. (live) (cc)(

programme.title: Mountain West Football Championship: San Diego State at Wyoming
programme.desc: San Diego State (9-3) at Wyoming (8-4). Workhorse RBs Donnel Pumphrey and Brian Hill highlight this rematch from two weeks ago in Laramie, where the Cowboys edged SDSU 34-33 after a failed two-point try. The Aztecs had won 17 straight conference games before the loss. (live) (cc)(

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: ESPN's flagship program provides a thorough presentation of sports news, highlights and analysis. The Emmy-winning show revolutionized the sports-news genre by deftly mixing information with irreverence in a hip, daily scrapbook of homers, touchdowns and slam dunks, the perfect clips-and-controversies fix for sports junkies. Staple features besides game scores and highlights include expert breakdowns, `Top Ten Plays', Web polls and trivia. (live) (cc)(

programme.title: NFL Primetime
programme.desc: Highlights and in-depth analysis of National Football League action. Launched in 1987, the show was a popular lead-in to ESPN's Sunday-night NFL coverage for two decades before moving to Mondays in 2006. The original format delivered game clips, statistics and analysis at an unrelenting pace to sate the fervent fan base of the NFL. (live) (cc)(n).

programme.title: NFL Insiders
programme.desc: In-depth analysis of the latest NFL news from insiders, reporters and former league executives, examining how and why team and player decisions are made. (live) (cc)(n).

programme.title: NFL Live
programme.desc: National Football League news, features and analysis. (live) (cc)(n).

programme.title: Highly Questionable *
programme.desc: Lively sports commentary by columnist Dan Le Batard (with input from his father) and Bomani Jones. Also features guest sports personalities and viewer feedback. (cc)(n).

programme.title: Around the Horn *
programme.desc: Columnists from around the U.S. debate hot sports topics in a competitive format and weigh in on stories from their region. (cc)(n).

programme.title: Pardon the Interruption *
programme.desc: A lively sports-talk show features opinionated reporters debating topical headlines. An on-screen `rundown' of the topics is a signature of the series, which also includes guests in and out of the studio, and responses to viewer calls and e-mail. (cc)(n).

programme.title: Monday Night Football: Colts at Jets
programme.desc: Indianapolis (5-6) at New York Jets (3-8). The Colts trot into MetLife Stadium on a two-game road winning streak after starting 0-3. Last season, Darrelle Revis and the Jets forced five turnovers in getting their third straight win over Indy, 20-7. (live) (cc).(n)

Stars Frances McDormand, William H. Macy and Steve Buscemi(

programme.desc: In this 80s comedy classic, a suicidal hobo attempts to drown himself in a swimming pool owned by a wealthy Beverly Hills couple and when they reluctantly adopt him, he brings about startling and hilarious changes to the entire household. Stars Bette Midler, Richard Dreyfuss and Nick Nolte(

programme.title: Rescue Dogs
programme.desc: Family adventure set on a beach in sunny southern California, in which a restaurant owner enlists his rescue dog to take on an evil businessman and finds time to fall for a beautiful dancer(n).

programme.title: Apartment Troubles
programme.desc: Two codependent roommates, on the verge of eviction, flee New York for the promise of sunshine in Los Angeles where their friendship is tested by a chance at fame, a fortune teller and an amorous wealthy aunt. Features Megan Mullally and Jeffrey Tambor(n).

programme.title: What Women Want
programme.desc: Electrocuted in a hairdryer mishap, womanizing ad exec Nick Marshall (Mel Gibson) is suddenly able to hear the thoughts of the opposite sex. At first, Nick thinks he's been given a terrific advantage in the bedroom and the boardroom, but soon his psychic gift turns the once-clueless Nick into a better father, employee and man, a transformation that does not go unnoticed by his beautiful boss Darcy (Helen Hunt). Alan Alda, Marisa Tomei, Lauren Holly, Ashley Johnson and Mark Feuerstein costar in this comedy blockbuster(n).

programme.title: Weiner
programme.desc: Documentary featuring a jaw-dropping, behind-the-scenes look at the attempted comeback of Anthony Weiner in 2013 as he mounts a campaign for New York City mayor in the wake of his sexting scandal. But it's not long before history repeats itself and new sexting allegations leave Weiner and his aides scrambling to contain the damage. Featuring unfettered access to the candidate and his campaign. Winner of the 2016 Sundance Grand Jury Prize for U.S. Documentary(n).

programme.title: Zero Days
programme.desc: Documentary from Oscar-winning filmmaker Alex Gibney that explores the phenomenon of Stuxnet, a self-replicating computer virus discovered in 2010 that was allegedly commissioned by the US and Israeli governments to sabotage Iran's nuclear program that opened up a Pandora's box of cyber warfare(n).

programme.title: Wristcutters: A Love Story (2006)
programme.desc: After breaking up with his girlfriend, a young man decides to end it all, only to discover a run-down afterlife that is strikingly similar to his old one. When he discovers his ex-girlfriend is there too, he sets out on an absurd road trip through purgatory to find her(n).

programme.desc: Kyle MacLachlan stars as a college student who returns home after his father has a stroke and discovers a severed ear in an abandoned field. When he attempts to find out what has happened, he is drawn into a dark, depraved and mysterious world. David Lynch directs. Co-stars Isabella Rossellini, Dennis Hopper and Laura Dern.(n)

programme.title: Public Enemy: Live from Metropolis Studios
programme.desc: Documentary featuring a special performance by one of the most influential hip hop acts of all time at the world famous Metropolis Sound Studio in London. Twenty-five years after the release of Public Enemy's most successful album Fear of a Black Planet, the rap legends Chuck D, Flavor Flav, DJ Lord and The S1W perform all of their fan favorites, interspersed with frank interview footage.(n)

programme.desc: Bored by her new town and classmates, the new girl (Kat Dennings) seduces a handsome teacher, flirts with a stoner, and avoids a local serial killer targeting teenagers. Josh Lucas and Reece Thompson costar in this offbeat dark comedy.(n)
